links.*: The Book of Lost Tales Part Two

wikitext.*:
'''Lord of Belegost''' was a title for one who ruled over the [[Dwarves|Dwarven]] city of [[Belegost]]. He was probably descended by one of the [[Seven Fathers of the Dwarves]]. An heirloom of the Lords of Belegost had been the pearl [[Nimphelos]] given by [[Thingol]].<ref>{{S|Sindar}}</ref>

The only known Lord of Belegost was [[Azaghâl]].<ref>{{UT|Narn}}, p. 75</ref>

In ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', [[Bodruith]] was the Lord of the [[Dwarves of Belegost]]<ref>{{LT2|IV}}</ref> during a [[battle in the Thousand Caves]] against [[Menegroth]]. He was later slain by [[Ufedhin]], an [[Elves of Doriath|Elf of Artanor]], after attempting to kill and steal the [[Nauglafring]] from him out of greed.
